benchmark_details.name: MM-CamObj (Multimodal Dataset for Camouflaged Object Scenarios)
benchmark_details.overview: The MM-CamObj dataset is constructed for the first time to improve large vision-language models (LVLMs) in understanding camouflaged objects. It includes two subsets: CamObj-Align, containing 11,363 image-text pairs for VL alignment, and CamObj-Instruct, comprising 11,363 images and 68,849 diverse instruction-following conversations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the capabilities of LVLMs in complex scenarios involving camouflaged objects.

data.source: Constructed from existing datasets for camouflage scene understanding
data.size: 11,363 images for CamObj-Align, 11,363 images and 68,849 conversations for CamObj-Instruct, 600 images for CamObj-Bench
data.annotation: Annotations include detailed descriptions from GPT-4o, manual reviews for corrections.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the evaluation of seven established tasks in the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance in recognizing and understanding camouflaged objects.
methodology.baseline_results: CamObj-Llava models outperform existing LVLMs in tasks targeting camouflage scenes.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted using a dataset designed to assess removal of camouflaged objects and effectiveness in recognition tasks.
